title: 2025 TVS Ronin launched at Rs 1.35 lakh, gets new colours
description: TVS has introduced the updated 2025 Ronin in India, now featuring two new color options and a safety upgrade. The mid-spec variant now comes equipped with dual-channel ABS. Let’s take a closer look at what’s new. The mid-spec DS variant now costs Rs 2000 more Remains mechanically unchanged 2025 TVS Ronin: What’s New? TVS had showcased the updated Ronin at MotoSoul 2024 and now has officially announced the prices. The TVS Ronin now comes in Midnight Blue, Glacier Silver and Charcoal Ember, while the alloy wheels now feature color-coded rim stickers.    Meanwhile the overall design remains unchanged. The updated TVS Ronin is priced at Rs 1.35 lakh for the base (SS) variant and Rs 1.59 lakh for the mid-spec (DS) variant. A key upgrade is the introduction of dual-channel ABS in the mid-spec (DS) variant while the base variant (SS) continues with single-channel ABS.  The top (TD) variant remains unchanged and is available at Rs 1.69 lakh. While the prices for the base and top variants remain unchanged, the mid-spec (DS) variant now costs Rs 2,000 more due to the addition of dual-channel ABS. Aside from the new colors, minor graphic updates, and the addition of dual-channel ABS in the mid variant, everything else stays the same. The Ronin continues to be powered by a 225.9cc, single-cylinder engine, delivering 20.4hp at 7,750rpm and 19.93Nm at 3750rpm. All prices mentioned above are ex-showroom, Delhi. Also see: Aprilia Tuono 457 launched at Rs 3.95 lakh
author: Gavin Rodrigues

html:
The TVS Ronin mid-spec DS variant now gets dual-channel ABS as standard.

TVS has introduced the updated 2025 Ronin in India, now featuring two new color options and a safety upgrade. The mid-spec variant now comes equipped with dual-channel ABS. Let’s take a closer look at what’s new.

  1. The mid-spec DS variant now costs Rs 2000 more
  2. Remains mechanically unchanged

2025 TVS Ronin: What’s New?

TVS had showcased the updated Ronin at MotoSoul 2024 and now has officially announced the prices. The TVS Ronin now comes in Midnight Blue, Glacier Silver and Charcoal Ember, while the alloy wheels now feature color-coded rim stickers. 

Meanwhile the overall design remains unchanged. The updated TVS Ronin is priced at Rs 1.35 lakh for the base (SS) variant and Rs 1.59 lakh for the mid-spec (DS) variant. A key upgrade is the introduction of dual-channel ABS in the mid-spec (DS) variant while the base variant (SS) continues with single-channel ABS. 

The top (TD) variant remains unchanged and is available at Rs 1.69 lakh. While the prices for the base and top variants remain unchanged, the mid-spec (DS) variant now costs Rs 2,000 more due to the addition of dual-channel ABS.

Aside from the new colors, minor graphic updates, and the addition of dual-channel ABS in the mid variant, everything else stays the same. The Ronin continues to be powered by a 225.9cc, single-cylinder engine, delivering 20.4hp at 7,750rpm and 19.93Nm at 3750rpm.

All prices mentioned above are ex-showroom, Delhi.
